data.sampled:
The max loss and gain for the four trades would be calculated as follows:

1. Selling 1 $143 put with $0.94 sold: Loss of ($143 - ($0.94 / 100)) = ($142.03) = [$142.03].
2. Buying 1 $157.5 put with $5.13 bought: Purchase cost = ($157.5 + ($5.13 / 100)) / 100 = ($157.25) = [$-$157.25].
3. Selling 1 $167.5 call with $0.37 sold: Loss of ($167.5 + ($0.37 / 100)) = ($165.3) = [-$165.3].
4. Buying 1 $157.5 call with $3.05 bought: Purchase cost = ($157.5 + ($3.05 / 100)) / 100 = ($155.45) = [-$155.45].

Adding the four losses and gains, the total loss would be:

($142.03 + -$157.25 + -$165.3 + -$155.45) / 100 = $33.51 or [-$33.51]

And the total gain would be:

($157.25 - $157.5) / 100 = 0.025 or [0.025]

Therefore, the max loss from the four trades would be [-$33.51] and the max gain would be [0.025].
